description: Erection of a two storey side extension and a single storey ground floor rear extension
decision_conditions: <p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The materials used in any exterior work shall be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing building.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-cb5a19a9-7fff-7c65-6e3e-4bd8747e167d"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: To ensure that the proposal does not detract from the character and appearance of the surrounding area.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;background-color:#ffffff;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 10pt 0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#222222;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">No development shall commence, other than works of demolition, until a report (including intrusive investigation/trial pit and monitoring where necessary) demonstrating that the development will not increase the potential for groundwater flooding to itself or to the surrounding area and </span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;">provide a plan showing the finished floor levels and the estimated flood levels, </span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">en</span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;">sure the floor levels are either no lower than existing floor levels or 300 millimetres (mm) above the estimated flood level. If they are not, extra flood resistance and resilience measures may be required.  If your design aims to keep out a depth of more than 600 mm of water, you should get advice from a structural engineer.</span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;">&nbsp;The plans need to show how you’re going to ensure the development is not flooded by surface water. </span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;">Where groundwater is identified as a potential risk, details of appropriate controls including flood resilience and/or resistance measures shall be submitted to the</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;"> Local Planning Authority for approval</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: To reduce the risks from surface water flooding.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-d98c7b15-7fff-4a82-4383-87788ee08fca"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;background-color:#ffffff;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:10pt;padding:10pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
